body: @isaacs @indutny I put another version of this together at https://github.com/apache/couchdb/pull/68 and here's a gist of it in action: https://gist.github.com/rnewson/5830208
Em... well, I'm almost done with my version. Do you want to wait for it first?
Let's see it, sure.
Also, the restriction on _all_docs and _changes needs addressing?

@rnewson I'm not really sure, may be @isaacs can weight in? Also, updated.

It seems that doing the same thing for _all_docs and _changes is quite complex and will require a lot of checks through the code base, but I can do it as well if you guys feel like its required.
Note that test doesn't work yet... for some reason.
The question was to you (or @isaacs). Do you need _all_docs to return the list of users when this public users flag is on?

As far as I concerned its used in only one, probably not important, place in npm (particularly - autocompletion), but @isaacs might have better insights on it.

The problem with approach in your and mine pull requests is that it doesn't apply immediately, because sys callbacks are being cached in `ets` (?). This is why the test is failing.
Ah, its just config value not updated immediately...
no, I have a working test, just about to push.
I feel a little bit confused. Is it regular a couchdb practice to double efforts and create the same code yourself, ignoring contributed patch?
I don't think they're the same but if you don't want my help I'm having to rescind it and restrict myself to commenting on your PR.
No I just think you better figure it out yourself.
@indutny not sure to follow, did you just stopped to work on that PR?
@indutny mistook my interest and collaboration for malice, I think. It's a shame.
Ok, lets call it mood issues then :P
@rnewson sorry for aggression.

:) Now let's get this patch finished. The code I showed that grabs and unpacks a list of inputs is useful here I think, and we use that exact scheme in other places (that is, I stole it from the vhost_global_handlers code). 

Our new rule is that patches land with tests _and_ docs and I'm happy to assist with both.

Well, I've almost finished test on my own... but I'll be very glad if you'll help me with docs!

And I'll use regexp splitting solution as you've just mentioned.
@rnewson force pushed with working test and `re:split` filter value gathering.
I still think that we need both whitelist and blacklist for situations where fields are known and respectively unknown.

Yes, npm does use the _all_docs feed of the public_users database.  I think that if _users docs become safely non-private, then _all_docs should be supported.

And @benoitc's point about upgrades has convinced me that a whitelist is the way to go here.  I take back my earlier complaints about that.  However, the `_id`, `_rev`, and `roles` should probably always be included, since it's not a valid user doc without those.

_id and _rev should always be included, yes. Not as sure about roles, though. If "must be valid user doc" is the rule, then that includes password_sha, derived_key, etc, so the rule must be more nuanced than that.
Yeah, I guess roles is less important, and I can just add it to my whitelist if I want it.
So, only whitelist, right?
I'm fine with just a whitelist if that does what npm needs. The gap between this patch and https://github.com/apache/couchdb/pull/68 gets narrower.

I have been convinced.  A whitelist is better, and it's what I would prefer for npm's purposes.  Please do go with that.

If someone can come up with a use case that isn't adequately served without a blacklist, then that's fine.  For me, it's a very slight increase in pain of using it, but a very large decrease in pain if any new private fields are added to _users docs in future versions.
@rnewson I've pulled your stuff and added handling for users' `_all_docs` view.
Nice work, I think we're about ready to merge. I'd like to see some other opinions here but it looks good to me.
Cool! Do you want me to rebase two commits into one?
yes please.
Ok, done.
Merged!
Obsoleted by #67.
Yay, thank you!
Merged, thanks!
Awesome! You're welcome.

[Committed](https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=couchdb.git;a=commit;h=ef9ac4699b9d68bdf1d5f0ae0169867af593795c), thanks!
I'd modified a bit by adding references to descriptions of some argument objects and preserve 80 chars of text per line.
That's just a first step. What I really want is that the source database doesn't need to be a full Apache CouchDB, but can also be a simple web server that serves up static files.
merged, thanks! <3
Thank you!
Hey, this is merged in. @deathbearbrown you can close this PR.
other than that, +1 to go straight into branch 1781-reorganize-and-improve-docs. thanks for your contribution!

Hey, @dedalozzo !
Thanks for PR, I'm currently rewriting API reference and a bit lazy to stash/unstash things (: I'll merge it a bit later today.
Merged you can close this.
Merged you can close this.
I exposed the method instead of making a direct gen_server call, it seemed tidier.
merged, thanks!
Ok, good. I'm going to close this.
Keep up the good work!
Applies, thanks!
Committed, thanks!
Drop MacPorts?
MacPorts chapter was there twice, I removed the original portion, keeping the one I changed.
merged, thanks!
You are welcome
merged, thanks!

INSTALL.Unix is for source redistribution. When you downloading CouchDB sources from web-site you don't need to `./bootstrap`. However, when you getting sources from git, you have to  follow `DEVELOPERS` file instructions where `./bootstrap` is mentioned.
To clarify @kxepal's comment, bootstrap is correctly _not_ mentioned in INSTALL.Unix.
ok, I got it. Thanks!
Other than some small comments/changes I'm +1 for this.

I'm -1 on this.

It's about solving specific use-case problem, not how replication works in general. CouchDB allows DELETE documents and any user _MAY_ send such request. To forbid this you need setup validate_doc_update function and since this point the way goes into application specifics, not replication.

@shimaore thanks for sending a PR on improving the docs! I think the "why" is covered in JIRA now, but it would be great if you can align your PR with that discussion, it will be a welcome addition to the docs.
@kxepal is there a better place in the documentation where this would belong to?
Just noticed that my proposed changes cause the Travis R16B build to fail, but the R15B or R14B ones are OK. More work to be done...
merged, good find :)
merged, good find :)
pushed, thanks!
merged, thx!
[Committed](http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/couchdb/commit/1944276f), thanks!

Just wonder if documented bugs will become the features..(:

I think this information is better to place into some troubleshooting article - the single source of known problems and their solutions. Actually, I'd planned to do this soon (just 
need to find the strength to systematize all available information), but you may lay the first brick of this big wall(: Would you like to?

Hi @eross !

I [pushed](https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=couchdb.git;a=commit;h=f990037388909a6d6307d7396e8c6274f282e563) your solution to the troubleshooting guide. Will merge with master when I place a bit more content there.

@NorthNick The test in question can fail intermittently on Travis. this should of course not be the case, but we havent found the time to get to the root cause of it yet. The failing does not indicate an error in your code MOST likely. E.g. if you can verify a full `make distcheck` locally, you should be fine.

@janl Thanks for the tip - that is good to know. My dev environment is Windows, which adds its own layers of complexity to testing, but I do have a 1.5.0-rc3 R16B02 Windows build, so will try to do something with that.
@NorthNick heh, what I meant to say: you are all good, no worries about this one test failure :)
@janl Ah - I see what you mean. In that case it would be great if someone can eventually review my beginner's Erlang with an eye to including the patch in a later release.

[Merged](https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=couchdb.git;a=commit;h=e3b0c245ecd5e8d7ee9779183032c63c92f694cb), thanks!  Blame me for these misspellings (: 

You may close PR now (we cannot do this, for now).
otherwise looks good to me! great work! :)

Good find(: [Merged](https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=couchdb.git;a=commit;h=e79dbdd3d250781dd47bde8600af5cac3937b2ac), thanks!

You may close PR now since we cannot (for now).
Thanks, @BigBlueHat , but this file needs to be completely rewritten. Hold on, I'm checking the last bits (:
Thanks @janl. I'll rework the code and update the pull request.
Travis build still failing, but that seems to be to do with plug-ins.
@NorthNick how do you figure that it is a plugins issue?

@janl It's based on naive searching of the [log](https://s3.amazonaws.com/archive.travis-ci.org/jobs/13118599/log.txt) for "error". In particular the final few lines say:

```
make[2]: Entering directory `/home/travis/build/apache/couchdb/apache-couchdb-1.5.0+build.417918a/_build/src'
make[2]: *** No rule to make target `my-first-couchdb-plugin/priv/default.d/my_first_couchdb_plugin.ini', needed by `distdir'.  Stop.
make[2]: Leaving directory `/home/travis/build/apache/couchdb/apache-couchdb-1.5.0+build.417918a/_build/src'
make[1]: *** [distdir] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory `/home/travis/build/apache/couchdb/apache-couchdb-1.5.0+build.417918a/_build'
make: *** [distcheck] Error 1
```

The message about not having a rule to make my_first_plugin.ini was the best explanation I could find for why the build stopped. However, there's a good chance that I missed something else in there.
Ah neat, I didnt know about full logs on S3. Can you rebase current master onto your branch, just to make sure this isnt fixed already?
@janl Of course - should have done that in the first place. I'll just need to level up my git foo a bit...

@janl I'm sorry but I have to ask for git help here, as my ignorance will probably create havoc otherwise. Having fetched to my local repository from upstream, do I then need to checkout the feature branch, do git rebase upstream/master, and then push the branch to my github repository? Or do I have the rebasing the wrong way round, or am I doing completely the wrong thing?
@NorthNick looks good to me :)
@janl still getting the same Travis build failure. I'm also unsure of whether my branch is in the intended state, but I think it is.
@NorthNick I think your branch is alright and shouldnt throw an error. Ill investigate tomorrow,
Cool. :grinning: Closing this then. :ship:
+1, and nice of you to add the forwarding function.
The commit message also needs work. The title should be more specific than "fix".

Thanks for these comments, @rnewson.

Today is basically the first day I dig into real Erlang code, so I might have missed a few important details. :)

Thanks @stevebest. I pulled in the fix and did the little bits I commented about. You're credited in the commit message, thanks for the push on this. We can't merge the PR because our GH integration is incomplete, so please close this when you can.

This little spelling thingie cost me an evening or two, so I'll close it when I see my name! :)

BTW, you guys do an awesome job.
@stevebest thanks for spotting this! Funny, that "typo" in docs helped to solve typo in code(:

@kxepal That was especially difficult to debug as I was checking extra hard to not write authenti_fi_cation in config, as this is the correct spelling in both @benoitc's native French and my native Russian!
Cool. I'm closing this one as I don't think it's needed any longer (from you said). Thanks!
Same here, glad to see this little annoyance go away.
